channel.title: math.CV updates on arXiv.org
channel.description: math.CV updates on the arXiv.org e-print archive.

item.title: Schwarzian Norm Estimates for Analytic Functions Associated with Convex Functions
item.dc:creator: Molla Basir Ahamed, Rajesh Hossain, Sabir Ahammed

item.title: Sphericity and Analyticity of a strictly pdeusoconvex hypersurface in low regularity I
item.description: arXiv:2506.20177v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: In our earlier work \cite{KZ}, we introduced an analytic regularizability theory for smooth strictly pseudoconvex hypersurfaces in complex space. That is, we found a necessary and sufficient condition for a hypersurface to be CR-equivalent to an analytic target. The condition amount to the holomorphic extension property for a smooth function on a totally real submanifold, both the function and the submanifold being uniquely associated with the given hypersurface. In the present paper, we develop our method further. First, we extend the result in \cite{KZ} to hypersurfaces of finite (possibly low) smoothness. Second, we introduce a new tool for studying CR hypersurfaces in low regularity called {\em regularizing $(0,1)$ sections}. Using the latter key tool, we solve the open problem of checking the {\em sphericity} of a strictly pseudoconvex hypersurface in $\mathbb C^{2}$ in {low regularity}, precisely in the regularity $C^k,\,2\leq k< 7$ which is {\em not} covered by the classical Cartan-Tanaka-Chern-Moser theory. As an application of our theory, we deduce the sphericity of a strictly pseudoconvex hypersurface in $\mathbb C^{2}$ of regularity $C^6$ with vanishing Cartan-Chern CR-curvature.
item.dc:creator: Ilya Kossovskiy, Dmitri Zaitsev

item.title: New results on universal Taylor series via weighted polynomial approximation
item.description: arXiv:2506.20224v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: We use weighted polynomial approximation to prove the existence of a compact set K with non-empty interior and a function f is dense in the space A(K) of all continuous functions on K that are holomorphic in the interior of K, endowed with the sup norm, while the set This improves a result of Mouze. The main ideas of the proof also allows us to construct a holomorphic function while the modulus of its non-zero Taylor coecients go to $\infty$. In passing, we complement a result by Pritsker and Varga on weighted polynomial approximation by proving that, for any compact set K with connected complement, there exists a constant $\alpha$ K > 0 such that there exists a bounded domain G containing K such that the weighted polynomials of the form z $\alpha$n P n , with deg(P n ) $\le$ n, are dense in H(G) for the topology of locally uniform convergence if and only if $\alpha$ < $\alpha$ K . Explicit computations of $\alpha$ K are given for some simple compact sets K.
item.dc:creator: St\'ephane Charpentier (I2M), Konstantinos Maronikolakis

item.title: On the Commuting Problem of Toeplitz Operators on the Harmonic Bergman Space
item.description: arXiv:2503.09112v3 Announce Type: replace Abstract: In this paper, we provide a complete characterization of bounded Toeplitz operators $T_f$ on the harmonic Bergman space of the unit disk, where the symbol $f$ has a polar decomposition truncated above, that commute with $T_{z+\bar{g}}$, for a bounded analytic function $g$.
item.dc:creator: H. Iqtaish, I. Louhichi, A. Yousef

item.title: Approximation of biholomorphic maps between Runge domains by holomorphic automorphisms
item.description: arXiv:2505.15129v2 Announce Type: replace Abstract: We show that biholomorphic maps between certain pairs of Runge domains in the complex affine space $\mathbb C^n$, $n>1$, are limits of holomorphic automorphisms of $\mathbb C^n$. A similar result holds for volume preserving maps and also in Stein manifolds with the density property. This generalizes several results in the literature and provides a considerably simpler proof.
item.dc:creator: Franc Forstneric

item.title: On Bott's residue formula for toric complete intersections
item.description: arXiv:2506.19790v2 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: We determine the number of singularities - counted whit multiplicities - of generic distributions of dimension and codimension one on smooth complete intersections in compact toric orbifolds with isolated singularities. We also present some applications of this results. First, we analyze the case of regular distributions. As a second application, we establish a Poincar\'e-type inequality that relates the multidegree of a foliation to the multidegrees of an invariant smooth complete intersection curve.
item.dc:creator: Miguel Rodr\'iguez Pe\~na
